meanings.definition: A shallow wooden basket for carrying or storing vegetables or fruit.
meanings.sent1: She filled the trugs with fresh apples from the orchard.
meanings.sent2: The farmer used a trug to gather the ripe tomatoes.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel tried to hide in the trug filled with nuts.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter echoed through the orchard as she balanced the trug on her head.
meanings.sent5: The trug creaked under the weight of the harvested carrots.

meanings.definition: To carry or transport in a trug.
meanings.sent1: He trugs the firewood from the shed to the fireplace every evening.
meanings.sent2: She trugs the groceries from the car to the kitchen in one trip.
meanings.sent3: The children giggled as they trugged their toys to the playroom.
meanings.sent4: The ants trugged the food crumbs back to their nest with great effort.
meanings.sent5: The old man trugs his memories with him wherever he goes.

meanings.definition: Trugs (plural noun): A collection of shallow wooden baskets.
meanings.sent1: The market displayed a variety of trugs filled with colorful flowers.
meanings.sent2: The storage room was filled with trugs of different sizes and shapes.
meanings.sent3: The trugs lined up neatly along the garden fence, ready for use.
meanings.sent4: The trugs stacked in the corner reminded her of a wooden fortress.
meanings.sent5: The trugs clattered as they were moved around the workshop.
